title: Melbourne tram derails in Kew and smashes through a front yard
text:
A tram carrying more than 20 passengers has derailed into a resident's fence after colliding with an SUV.

The crash forced the tram into a woman's frontyard on Cotham Road in Kew, Melbourne before at about 11.35am on Sunday.

Multiple passengers had fallen on top of each other and a baby landed on broken glass, 9News reported.

A tram carrying more than 20 passengers has derailed into a resident's fence after colliding into an SUV

The car which was struck by the tram has been left with significant damages to its front and rear and the occupants of the car have been freed

The crash forced the tram into a woman's frontyard on Cotham Road in Kew, Melbourne before at about 11.35am on Sunday

At least seven people were treated at the scene by ambulance and taken to hospital with non life-threatening injuries.

The car which was struck by the tram has been left with significant damages to its front and rear and the occupants of the car have been freed.

Passengers on board the tram told 7News the driver of the SUV recklessly drove in front of the tram as it was travelling.

Route 109 trams have been put to a halt between Findon Crescent and Box Hill.

Passengers looking for route alternative to the 109 are advised to travel on the Belgrave/Lilydale lines.

Route 48 trams were previously affected but services have since resumed.

The circumstances behind the collision are still being investigated.

At least seven people were treated at the scene by ambulance and taken to hospital with non life-threatening injuries
description: The crash forced the tram into a woman's front yard on Cotham Road in Kew, Melbourne before at about 11.35am on Sunday.
authors: Paula Ahillon For Daily Mail Australia
